conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and apply the first law of thermodynamics.
Process A to B is isochoric (constant volume) at 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Process B to C is isobaric (constant pressure) at 1 x 10^5 Pa.
No work is done from A to B since volume is constant.
Work done from B to C is 200 J using W = PΔV.
Change in internal energy for an ideal gas depends on temperature change.
Temperature at B is 100 K using ideal gas law for isochoric process.
Temperature at C is 300 K using ideal gas law for isobaric process.
Change in internal energy from A to B is -300nR.
Change in internal energy from B to C is 300nR.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Heat transferred from A to B is Q_AB = -300nR.
Heat transferred from B to C is Q_BC = 300nR + 200.
Final answer: Total heat transferred is 200 J.
